p: Pure and not milled LiAlH 4 undergoes a melting transition, at 160–180 °C before undergoing a first dehydrogenation reaction to give Li 3AlH 6 and Al at 180–220 °C, Equation (15). A second dehydrogenation reaction is observed to occur at 228–282 °C to give LiH and Al, Equation (16) [ 70, 71]: LiAlH 4 → 1/3 Li 3AlH 6 + 2/3 Al + H 2 (15)
